content: What shell command can I use to determine the version of pip that I am currently using? I tried using 'pip show' but it only shows the versions of the installed modules and not pip itself.

To determine the version of `pip` you are currently using, you can use the following shell command:

```bash
pip --version
```

This command will output the version of `pip` along with the Python version and the location of the `pip` installation.
